definitions.text:
Overcharge
1. To or load to excess; to cloy; to oppress.The heavy load of abundance with which we overcharge nature -
2. To crowd too much.Our language is overcharged with consonants.
3. To burden.
4. To fill to excess; to surcharge; as, to overcharge the memory.
5. To load with too great charge, as gun.
6. To too much; to enter in an account more than is just.OVERCHARGE,

1. An excessive load or burden.
2. in an account of more than is just.
3. beyond what is proper.
